timeline.author: Arun-LinkedIn

timeline.bodyText: It seems this method uses both return false and AccountServiceException to handle failure cases. Can we throw AccountServiceException everywhere to make it consistent? Also we can consider removing boolean return value, if the method goes through without exception, then it should be a success.
timeline.author: jsjtzyy

replies.bodyText: Feel free to add new type of error code to AccountServiceErrorCode
replies.author: jsjtzyy

replies.bodyText: I didn't know what to do about the case where config.updateDisabled = true.  What exception should that be?  Kind of seems like IllegalState.  Do we ever actually turn off account updates?
replies.author: lightningrob

replies.bodyText:
Maybe this case justifies TemporaryDisabled and from customer point's of view, it's 503 (Unavailable) error.
This config was introduced to migrate ZK based metadata store to router based metadata store. It gives us an option to temporarily turn off any account update during the migration (to avoid potential race condition).
We can remove this or if you think it's useful for account service migration, then we can keep it.

timeline.bodyText: Is this because  throwing AccountServiceException will bring lots of changes in too many places?
